history.content:
Yes you should definitely take Math 110 if you want to learn linalg properly (and not just the high-level intuition you get from EE 16AB). It is foundational linear algebra material that shows up in so many places, especially AI and machine learning.

________

I highly recommend Math 110 if you are intending to take EECS 127 in the future. EECS 127 relies on a good intuition of linear algebra (inner product spaces, symmetric matrices) which Math 110 will help a lot with. In EECS 126, having a good knowledge of Math 110 helps a lot too (for example, Jordan normal form helps the understanding of generator matrix in CTMC).

-------

I think 127 by itself will provide the kind of intuition you're looking for. And I think if you're a strong-ish student, it's pretty doable with just 16a under your belt (this is what I did, and I did well in 127). Math 110 adds a couple of useful topics (e.g. Jordan forms) and a different perspective, but I would prioritize just taking 127 instead.

children.subject: <md>Thank you so much for the response! This is ***very*** helpful for me! (from the author of the post</md>

history.content:
<md>For context, I'm a freshman and intended CS stats, and I'm wondering the necessity and usefulness of Math 110 in future CS coursework, namely CS 126, 127, 189, and ML related coursework. I'm taking EE16A this semester and feeling the course is not providing the in-depth definition for many concepts and I want to dig deeper into this subject and want to really "master" linear algebra (theories w/o proofs for me is kinda *hanging in the air* type of matter for me and making me feeling I'm may not fully master the concept). At the same time, I heard from juniors and seniors that the linear algebra used in upper div courses do not require very very in-depth knowledge of linear algebra. So I have a mixed feeling for this course. 

Do any1 can kindly provide your insight for this, I'm currently inclining to take Math110 next semester.</md>
history.subject: Is Math 110 helpful for upper div or research work in CS (AI/ML domain)?
